name: places/ChIJo8AUS3f2wokRSx5k7HknH9g
formattedAddress: 2363 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10030, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2363 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10030, USA

originalText.text: I spent all of 2022 searching for the best chocolate chip cookie in NYC. And let me tell you, this place has the second best cc cookie in the city. While maintaining slightly less complex flavors than other top CC cookies, it has a homemade taste and feel that brings you back to your childhood. At $7 it is perhaps one of the most expensive cc cookies in the city, however, this chocolate factory is a wonderful fusion of history, culture, and chocolate and worth every penny to support and enjoy. Make sure to get it warm!

text.text: I spent all of 2022 searching for the best chocolate chip cookie in NYC. And let me tell you, this place has the second best cc cookie in the city. originalText.text:
I was happy to come during business hours on a Saturday, I have been wanting to try this place for a little bit now. I brought some truffles and a bar to a family i work with, and we were so happy with them! first off, the service was super friendly, welcoming, and helpful, but those truffles!!!…. They really do a great job at interpreting southern flavor through chocolate.  The banana pudding will put you in mind of a summer picnic! Our favorite was the Bodega dreams which had the sweet and salty going on.
I had some limitations because of allergies but next time i’ll try all the flavors!
The packaging was also super fancy and made it extra special.

originalText.text:
Close your eyes and think of the best chocolate you've ever had...know that THIS delicious chocolate is 10 times better!

Jessica/CEO has captured the essence of Harlem in the bon-bons and "brownstone bars". Be ready for the flavors of red velvet, banana pudding, sweet potato pie, and liqueurs in the chocolate treats.

I love dark chocolate, and Harlem Chocolate Factory holds the title for the best dark chocolate that I've ever had!

originalText.text: Wanted to stop by and support. I really enjoyed the Chocolate pretzel chips. That was my favorite out of my purchase. The $2.50 sweet potatoe, & red velvet choice was okay. The $10 Ace Of Spade was nothing special about it. Had to try it for myself, but it wasn't worth it. A bit pricey overall, but if your a chocolate lover, you may not mind.

originalText.text:
I bought the Sunday Soul collection
from them this afternoon. The
transaction was swift, and pleasant
and know I will enjoy the stuff
tonight.
I took a star off because I tried
coming here on August 4th (the
prior Friday). It was closed during
expected business hours and after
trying the number on the awning six
times, somebody responded that a
private event was getting handled.
Understandable but ! felt they could
have posted something on
Instagram (they did for something a
few weeks ago) or left a note on the
door.
I intend to come back here again. Shout out to New York Live for reviewing this place.
